content: 2 pick up 4 5 loops on hook work back row 3 pick up 6 7 loops on hook work back no color change row 4 pick up 8 9 loops on hook don t work back break yarn leaving about a 10 tail work the kitchener stitch as explained above for dishcloths finishing close up center hole as demonstrated in the video weave in the ends or cut them as demonstrated and follow the instructions on the yarn label for washing and drying modifying you can use this pattern to create any size of circle using these steps determine the size you want in inches at a gauge of 4 stitches per inch or whatever your gauge is multiply the number of inches by 4 to determine the stitch count of the diameter divide that number by two if the resulting number is an even number add one this is the number of stitches you will pick up from the provisional cast-on crochet chain work as indicated in the dishcloth above - picking up 2 stitches and working back picking up 4 stitches and working back picking up 6 stitches and working back etc change color at the end of the second-to-last row two stitches left to pick up then work last row in new color by picking up all stitches the same number you picked up from the provisional crochet chain work 11 segments this way on the 12th segment pick up all stitches and do not work a left-to-right row back use kitchener stitch as described for the dishcloth to seam copyright 2016 staci perry this pattern and pictures are the property of staci perry all rights reserved pattern is available for personal use only no unauthorized reproduction in whole or in part or distribution of this pattern or content including text or pictures is allowed no commercial reproduction of garments from this pattern is allowed without prior permission from staci perry
